snippet: The focus of the investigation returned to two people on board with expertise — the pilot and his first officer.
abstract: Investigation into disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 shifts to include anyone on board with navigation or aircraft background in response to evidence that plane was deliberately diverted from its route and, after communication was lost, navigated by someone with expertise; development brings new scrutiny to pilot and first officer, Capt Zaharie Ahmad Shah and Fariq Abdul Hamid.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and MICHAEL FORSYTHE
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple reported from Kuala Lumpur, and Michael Forsythe from Sepang, Malaysia.

lead_paragraph: The focus of the investigation returned to two people on board with expertise — the pilot and his first officer.

headline.main: Passengers and Crew of Missing Plane Scrutinized for Aviation Skills
headline.print_headline: Passengers and Crew of Missing Plane Scrutinized for Aviation Skills
